docs.lead_paragraph: In his third major appointment in as many days, Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani yesterday named Michael P. Jacobson as the Commissioner of the city's Department of Correction. Mr. Jacobson has run the city's jail system as Acting Commissioner since January 1995 and his formal appointment was not unexpected. He has been credited with reducing inmate violence while cutting employee overtime and absenteeism. Administration and union officials alike have praised Mr. Jacobson as a strong administrator and a capable problem solver.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Clinton Administration announced today that it would take steps to streamline the Food and Drug Administration's rules to speed cancer drugs to patients. President Clinton said the regulatory changes would apply to at least 100 drugs now under study. "Dozens of them will get to the market sooner and that means they can help Americans suffering from cancers of the breast, lung, ovary, prostate and colon, among others," he said at the White House.

headline.main: PRESIDENT ORDERS FASTER APPROVAL OF CANCER DRUGS
